intro: Jupunba curvicarpa var. rodriguesii, commonly known as the Rodrigues juniper, is a shrub native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, cone-like structures that contain seeds, typical of coniferous species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
